articles.title: Nvidia Investors Give Tepid Reaction to Upbeat Forecast - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Nvidia Corp., the dominant maker of artificial intelligence processors, failed to impress investors with its latest sales forecast, signaling that concerns about an overheated AI economy will continue to dog the company.

articles.title: Oregon company recalls 55,000 pounds of frozen berries due to listeria concerns - OregonLive.com
articles.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration bumped the recall to the highest urgency level Tuesday.

articles.title: IMF urges US to change course on economic policy - Financial Times
articles.description: Trump administration’s government job cuts threaten critical economic functions, fund warns

articles.title: Nvidia's CEO says agentic AI is driving chip demand - MarketWatch
articles.description: Nvidia reported earnings on Wednesday afternoon. The company vastly exceeded expectations with its guidance, but the report wasn't enough to spur a major positive stock reaction.

articles.title: Nvidia and other tech stocks lead Wall Street higher - AP News
articles.description: U.S. stocks rose and erased their losses for the week so far, as Nvidia and other technology companies led the way. The S&P 500 gained 0.8% Wednesday for a second straight gain following Monday’s swoon. The Dow Jones Industrial Average added 0.6%, and the Nas…

articles.title: KTLA layoffs hit local TV news hosts Mark Kriski, Lu Parker and Glen Walker - Los Angeles Daily News
articles.description: Kriski had delivered the morning weather forecasts since 1991 when KTLA created its morning news show.

articles.title: IonQ Stock Jumps After Earnings Beat. 2026 Revenue Outlook Tops Expectations. - Barron's

articles.description: Ted Sarandos is heading to the White House Thursday to salvage Netflix's bid for Warner Bros' studio & streaming assets

articles.title: Salesforce issues soft outlook amid concerns about AI’s threat to software - Financial Times
articles.description: Shares in company that sells software as a service fall after it projects revenue below Wall Street’s expectations

articles.title: Why Jeep's New Hurricane Four Turbo Engine Is Actually Insane - Motor1.com
articles.description: Using a mixture of F1-derived and high-performance technology, the Jeep Grand Cherokee's new base engine is a technical showcase.

articles.title: The White House wants AI companies to cover rate hikes. Most have already said they would. - TechCrunch
articles.description: Many hyperscalers have already made public commitments to cover electricity cost increases.

articles.title: Jim Cramer drops unexpected take on stock market - thestreet.com
articles.description: The CNBC host challenges the popular assumption about AI stocks driving market sentiment.

articles.title: US Data Center Construction Fell Amid Permit and Power Delays - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Construction of new data centers in the US fell for the first time since 2020 despite soaring demand for artificial intelligence computing capacity, as developers face delays in permitting, zoning and power procurement.

articles.title: If AI Causes an Office Job Wipeout, It’ll Cause Huge Problems for Blue Collar Work Too - Futurism
articles.description: All those white collar jobs that will supposedly be eliminated by AI won't be wiped out in a vacuum, an expert warns.

articles.title: Trump floats new retirement benefit for 54 million workers - The Washington Post
articles.description: The White House does not have the legal authority to do what the president suggested, and some experts are skeptical of proposed legislation.

articles.title: Shares of Kentucky bourbon company plummet, taking competitors’ stocks down too - Lexington Herald Leader
articles.description: Diageo halves dividend, lowers sales forecast, dragging Kentucky bourbon stocks like Bulleit and Louisville-based Brown-Forman as U.S. spirits demand softens.

articles.title: Netflix Stock Has Best Day In Over A Year After Paramount's New Warner Bros. Bid - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Netflix stock had its best day in over a year, after Warner Bros.' board said it still favored the streamer's merger deal over Paramount's.
